title: weird behavior with non-broadcasting masked_select: a bug?
body_html:
Hi, when I do this

import torch
A = torch.rand(5, 5, 1)
mask = torch.ByteTensor(5, 5).fill_(1)
B = torch.masked_select(A, mask)
B.size()

I get a warning about no broadcasting, but the output tensor is of weird size of torch.Size([125]). Its the same of both CPU and a GPU.
I'm on the head on the master branch.

It this an expected behavior or a bug? Some of older code broke because of this.

body:
Hi, when I do this
```
import torch
A = torch.rand(5, 5, 1)
mask = torch.ByteTensor(5, 5).fill_(1)
B = torch.masked_select(A, mask)
B.size()
```
I get a warning about no broadcasting, but the output tensor is of weird size of `torch.Size([125])`. Its the same of both CPU and a GPU.
I'm on the head on the master branch.

It this an expected behavior or a bug? Some of older code broke because of this.
